title-group.article-title: The Plot Thickens: Surveying Manuals, Drama, and the Materiality of Narrative Form in Early Modern England

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright 2002 The Johns Hopkins University Press

Duke likens her to one "that does exalt his enemy who, proving high, / Lays all the plots to confound him that rais'd him" (2.2.339-40)
Duke's moralizing brother: "Cardinal, you die this night, the plot's laid surely" (5.2.21)
